channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Approx 2’x10”x2”. Couldn’t take proper measurements as in a very busy main road, Princess Elizabeth Way. Almost opposite Cowper Rd., 27th February
item.description:
As stated above! Almost opposite Cowper Road heading north on P.E.Way. Just off the GCHQ roundabout. I have no idea how long the issue has been present. It blew my tyre. I had my grandchildren in the car and as a result couldn’t get home for at least 3 hours. I called the RAC and asked if this could be related to pothole's, he agreed! It’s cost me £148 to get a new tyre fitted for which I need compensation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Give Way Pinch Point Unsafe, 27th February
item.description:
The right of way pinch point north west of Vineries Close cannot cope with current traffic and does not work. It is too long to create safe visibility splays and is now causing drivers to mount the cycle path and there are near misses with school children and pedestrians. Another solution is needed, consultation required. One way system?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Futher potholes on Kidnappers Lane, 27th February
item.description:
The extremely high volume of traffic and the weather conditions have caused additional potholes on kidnappers lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kidnappers Lane Unsafe, 27th February
item.description:
Kidnappers Lane between Vineries Close and the pear trees development has lost its kerb on the western side. This is now unsafe due to cars not being able to judge distance from edge and driving away from the edge and blocking the carriageway causing vehicles in opposite direction to mount the shared cycle path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole section of path needs replacing, 27th February
item.description:
Some parts are marked with paint but it is lacking in common sense - the whole section needs replacing and fix the pit hole right beside it at the same time. Residents of no 2 would like the tiny grass patch filled in as it just turns to mud when it rains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Linden Close, Cheltenham
